def predict(triples: list[Triple]) -> str:
    predicates = {
        "cityServed": "serves the city of {}",
        "location": "is located in {}",
        "elevationAboveTheSeaLevel": "which is {} metres above sea level",
        "elevationAboveTheSeaLevelInFeet": "which is {} feet above sea level",
        "runwayName": "has a runway named {}",
        "runwayLength": "and has a runway length of {} metres",
        "1stRunwayLengthFeet": "and has a 1st runway length of {} feet",
        "country": "in {}",
        "isPartOf": "which is part of {}",
        "language": "where the language spoken is {}",
        "capital": "where the capital is {}",
        "nativeName": "also known as {}",
        "iataLocationIdentifier": "with the IATA code {}",
        "icaoLocationIdentifier": "and the ICAO code {}",
        "1stRunwaySurfaceType": "and has a 1st runway surface type of {}",
        "operatingOrganisation": "operated by {}",
        "aircraftHelicopter": "and has an aircraft helicopter of {}",
        "attackAircraft": "and has an attack aircraft of {}",
        "battle": "involved in the {} battle",
        "leader": "led by {}",
        "owner": "owned by {}",
        "hubAirport": "has a hub airport at {}",
    }

    subjects = {}
    for triple in triples:
        if triple.subject not in subjects:
            subjects[triple.subject] = []
        subjects[triple.subject].append((triple.predicate, triple.object))

    sentences = []
    for subject, triples_list in subjects.items():
        sentence = f"{subject} "
        for i, (predicate, obj) in enumerate(triples_list):
            if predicate in predicates:
                sentence += predicates[predicate].format(obj)
                if i < len(triples_list) - 1:
                    sentence += ", "
        sentences.append(sentence + ".")

    # Try to generate a single complex sentence
    if len(sentences) > 1:
        complex_sentence = sentences[0].strip()[:-1] + " which "
        for sentence in sentences[1:]:
            complex_sentence += sentence.strip()[:-1] + ", "
        complex_sentence = complex_sentence.strip()[:-1] + "."
        return complex_sentence
    else:
        # Try to connect the information of different triples
        if len(triples) > 1:
            complex_sentence = ""
            subject = triples[0].subject
            complex_sentence += f"The {subject} "
            for triple in triples:
                if triple.predicate in predicates:
                    complex_sentence += predicates[triple.predicate].format(triple.object)
                    if triple != triples[-1]:
                        complex_sentence += ", "
            return complex_sentence + "."
        else:
            return sentences[0]

# EVOLVE-BLOCK-END
